intro: Achyrospermum carvalhoi var. grandibracteatum, commonly known as the Brazilian blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy blue to violet flowers that bloom in dense, rounded clusters, creating a striking visual effect. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is often cultivated for its vibrant color and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
